title: Black Crowd
provenance_text:
Zao Wou-Ki [1921-2013], Paris, France [1]; Galerie Pierre, Paris, France; acquired by Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1955 [3].

Notes:
[1]. The Chinese artist lived and worked in Paris at this time. He became a French citizen in 1964 (see The New York Times, April 11, 2013.)
[2]. Galerie Pierre lent the painting to "The 1955 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Painting" held at Carnegie Institute, October-December 1955 (no. 324, illustrated, plate 124.)
[3]. The painting was a gift of G. David Thompson [1899-1965], Pittsburgh, PA from the 1955 International.
